column4: hey what do you guys think of this for a Ubuntu webserver logo http://68.231.152.140:8080/apache2-default/poweredby.png ?
not bad, but the font looks fuzzy
indeed, but the font is awfully small compared to the logo size imho
i suggest you shrink the logo a bit then
comes close, but if you want to put it at the bottom of a page, you should use the previous image with the logo as big as in this image, so that the images width is bigger than its height
ok so kinda like a banner then
that's the best one so far :)
just make sure the myhostname and myorigin (aka the contents of /etc/mailname) are correctly set to your domain name
http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/192 , that's for my server: virtualschoolllab.nl
now I own a domain...but a hoster has the DNS for it....that wouldn't let me use that domain on this box would it?
no, that should just be localhost :)

so if the mails are wating in queue...and flushing the queue comes back with postqueue: warning: valid_hostname: numeric hostname: 68.231.152.140 postqueue: warning: valid_hostname: numeric hostname: 231.152.140 what does that mean?
no idea, i'm not that used to postfix...
